<<<code>>>: try { PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(filename); writer.write(text); writer.flush(); writer.close(); } catch (FileNotFoundException e) { msg.setText("FileNotFoundException"); }
<<<explanation>>>: The code is trying to write the string "text" to a file specified by the filename variable. The PrintWriter class is used to write the data to the file. The write() method is used to write the data to the file. The flush() method is used to ensure that the data is written to the file immediately. The close() method is used to close the PrintWriter object and the file. The catch block is used to handle the FileNotFoundException that may occur if the file specified by the filename variable does not exist.
